question: What is the main hypothesis of the project described in the text, and how does it aim to improve Species Distribution Models (SDMs)?
answer: The main hypothesis of the project is that building a rich model of the sampling effort is the most promising direction to improve the state-of-the-art in SDMs. The project aims to achieve this by jointly learning the user behavior and species distributions in an end-to-end manner, leveraging the synergies between both tasks, and utilizing a hybrid approach that combines large amounts of available observation data with priors about the behavior of citizen scientists and wildlife.
